data.title: Markdown preview: some files flicker/reset scroll position on type
data.body:
In todays insider build I see bad flickering happen when I edit the source file of a markdown preview. This is so bad that it makes it really annoying to have the preview open while editing.

I verified this was not the case in 1.5.

At some point I see the scrollbar disapparing.

This is editing 1.6 release notes in our vscode-docs repo (which includes images, maybe related).

Eventually the flicker goes away, but here are steps that make it happen for me:
- fresh window (I am using the light theme)
- open 1.6 md
- open the preview to the side and do not scroll
- just type into the markdown file

data.title: No more action in debug viewlet to open repl?
data.body: I think we removed this button because we now have it in the sidebar, but the sidebar will not show it by default unless we flip that setting?

data.title: Nextline automatically when writing a markdown code
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Switch to markdown editor.
2. Writing a line that is much **longer** than the window.
3. It just keep **increasing** the length of the line, instead of switch to a **new line**.

> It's very **difficult** to read in this case. Otherwise, VS is a pretty good editor for markdown.

data.title: "Open with code" context menu should open in already open VS Code window
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1607 OS Build: 14393.187

Steps to Reproduce:
If VS Code is already open then doing "Open with code" context menu should open another file in same window. Snapshot is added for reference:
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16834561/18899653/24c71084-8558-11e6-8a22-1f4d2ac4afbf.png)
Here, 2.html is already open in VS Code. If I click on "Open with code" context menu on 1.html, it should open in same window. Not new VS Code window.

data.title: Conditional breakpoint can not be restored after restart and breaks debug UI
data.body:
While testing #12600.
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: MacOs

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open a workspace
2. open a js file
3. set breakpoint 
4. edit the breakpoint to be conditional
5. quit vscode
6. restart vscode
   -> editor on file as in step 2 opens; no breakpoint It creates the stack trace below
   -> When ups now debug the debugger still stops at the breakpoint but the yellow 'current execution point' indication gets stuck at the conditional break point. I.e. the debugging UI is broken.

```
shell.ts:441Cannot read property 'model' of undefined: TypeError: Cannot read property 'model' of undefined
    at e.getBreakpointDecorationOptions (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:82:14496)
    at file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:82:13777
    at Array.map (native)
    at e.createBreakpointDecorations (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:82:13744)
    at e.onModelAdded (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:82:10069)
    at e.invoke (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:29:20764)
    at e.fire (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:29:31336)
    at e.createModel (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:69:21524)
    at t.doCreateTextEditorModel (file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:80:13509)
    at file:////***/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:80:13263e.onUnexpectedError @ shell.ts:441
```

data.title: Font sizes / styles of IntelliSense tool tips are disconcerting?
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12598

I've been staring at this for far too long... but is it just me, or is the font size of the tooltip larger than the font in the editor? Whatever it is, there is something very disconcerting about the relative font sizes here to me - it looks like 3 separate font sizes, and two font styles (more if you count the tabs), and... I still haven't even come to terms with whether the dress is blue or gold... so this is just too much for me. :wink:

data.title: [json] no completions for enum values in alternatives

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing #12600.
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 insiders
- OS Version: MacOs

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Create the following `launch.json` file:

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
        {
            "name": "Launch",
            "type": "node"
        }
    ]
}
```

2) in the line 6 place caret in anywhere between the quotes in `"node"`.
3) Ctrl+Space
-> The only proposal you see is `node`. There should also be `node2`.

4) delete the word `node` in line 6
5) Ctrl+Space
-> You get all valid proposal for launch config types.

data.title: Quick info view provides improper affordances
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12598

If you over the view, the selection cursor appears, but you are not able to actually select the text. Either the text should be selectable (personally prefer this but the practicality of which is debatable), or it the selection cursor shouldn't appear at all. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18896631/1a0d186c-84d8-11e6-9d8d-4979254f0e24.png)

data.title: Replace 'outDir' with 'outFiles' in the error message for missing setting in Launch config
data.body:
Testing #12254

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In a node app with typescript files, configure the generated js files to be in a folder named anything but "out" 
2. Set up launch config, but do not specify `outDir`

You see the error message:

> Cannot launch program '.....'; setting the 'outDir' attribute might help

Now that we are deprecating outDir in favor of outFiles, the message should also reflect the same

data.title: Should be able to arrow key through quick info boxes

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12598

Right now when quick info view is open, there is no way to view the quick info of other options in the completion list without first backing out of the view
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18896433/8e0e75f0-84d6-11e6-8b7a-4fcc1557a50f.png)

This means that the user flow when attempting to choose between two options in the list is:
1. `ctrl+space` to open quick info
2. `ctrl+space` to close quick info
3. `arrow down` to view next item
4. `ctrl+space` to open quick info

This could be instead simplified to 
1. `ctrl+space` to open quick info 
2. `arrow down` to view quick info of next item

Also related: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12844

data.title: Quick Info should apply to all completion items, rather than selectively

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/12598

Right now Quick Info only appears for certain items in the list (e.g. `apply` and `call`, but not `all`)

quick info:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18896396/43ba774c-84d6-11e6-8c3b-a2ee9480b5ed.png)

no quick info:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/18896386/36ba7e8e-84d6-11e6-9432-4cafedff2d7a.png)

This results in an inconsistent user experience, where a user might ctrl+space in order to see additional details about the function (either because they believe there is documentation, or because the info they can see is cut off.)

Ideally, the quick info box would be displayed for every completion item, even if the documentation on that isn't _as_ comprehensive as the other options

data.title: Can install node-debug2 in old versions of vscode
data.body:
I can install node-debug2 in Code stable 1.5, even though it has a dependency on 1.6.0.

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2/blob/master/package.json#L46
Exactly the same as node-debug, which shows the correct error message - https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/blob/master/package.json#L24

I can't figure out what the difference is. I also don't know how to debug the gallery service code - I think it runs in a separate process?

data.title: Installed extensions should be sorted by display name, not publisher
data.body: At first glance it looks like the installed extensions are ordered randomly, but they are sorted by publisher id, with capital letters ordered first.

data.title: Highlight Markdown Image Starting ! Punctuator

Issue #12835

Adds colorization for the `!` that defines a markdown image link. The `!` is colored the same as the `[` after it.

data.title: Bizarre empty line behavior when using a proportional font
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Mac OS 10.9

It's not calculating the width of an empty line properly if using a proportional font. It updates as soon as the first character is entered. See the video. This wasn't the behavior in the original release of the system, it broke some time ago.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use a proportional font
2. Create a tabbed blank line.

![ezgif-178450921](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16612419/18894938/fddb7a56-84e3-11e6-914b-40c75cbc23c7.gif)

data.title: Markdown Preview Show Source Menu Button In Tabs Should Switch Back to Source File
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insidesr
##### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open two markdown files side by side
2. In the right file, click the show preview menu button.
3. In the right preview, click the show source button
##### Expected

The editor switches back to the markdown file in the right editor.
##### Actual

The source for the preview is opened as a new file in the left editor.

![sep-27-2016 15-50-28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18894866/596f2e90-84ca-11e6-883f-2d7f504c1f9f.gif)

Using the command palate, we run into other issues: see #12837
